title: Strapped And Stretched, Non-Profits Struggle To Defend Immigrant Minors
teaser: The Obama administration claims there are fewer unaccompanied minors crossing the U.S.-Mexico border; nevertheless, deportation hearings have accelerated. The situation has created a new challenge: There's a shortage of pro-bono attorneys to represent the immigrant children in immigration court.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
